metadata.name: TK Labels
metadata.description:
The Traditional Knowledge (TK) Labels are an initiative for Indigenous communities and local organizations.
This Vocabulary is used to create a TKLabels dataset with Describo.

who.label: Who
who.description: The roles of the people involved.

actions.label: Actions
actions.description: Actions that this entity is a part of.

Thing.name: Thing
Thing.help: The most generic type of item.

inputs.name: alternateName
inputs.help: An alias for the item.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: A description of the item.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links.

inputs.name: potentialAction
inputs.help: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

inputs.name: sameAs
inputs.help: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

inputs.help: The end date and time of the item.

CreativeWork.name: CreativeWork
CreativeWork.help: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

inputs.name: about
inputs.help: The subject matter of the content.

inputs.name: author
inputs.help: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

inputs.name: contributor
inputs.help: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

inputs.name: contentLocation
inputs.help: The location depicted or described in the content. For example, the location in a photograph or painting.

inputs.name: datePublished
inputs.help: DateTime, Date of first publication or broadcast. For example the date a CreativeWork was broadcast or a Certification was issued.

inputs.name: hasPart
inputs.help: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that is part of this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense).

inputs.name: keywords
inputs.help: Keywords or tags used to describe some item. Multiple textual entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas, or by repeating the property.

inputs.name: license
inputs.help: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

inputs.name: mainEntity
inputs.help: Indicates the primary entity described in some page or other CreativeWork.

inputs.name: mentions
inputs.help: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.

inputs.name: publisher
inputs.help: The publisher of the creative work.

inputs.name: alternateName
inputs.help: An alias for the item.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: A description of the item.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links.

inputs.name: sameAs

Person.name: Person
Person.help: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

inputs.name: givenName
inputs.help: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person.

inputs.name: additionalName
inputs.help: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.

inputs.name: familyName
inputs.help: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of a Person.

inputs.name: homeLocation
inputs.help: A contact location for a person's residence.

inputs.name: birthDate
inputs.help: Date of birth.

inputs.name: deathDate
inputs.help: Date of death.

inputs.help: Physical address of the item.

inputs.name: geo

Organization.name: Organization
Organization.help: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

inputs.name: foundingDate
inputs.help: The date that this organization was founded.

inputs.name: dissolutionDate
inputs.help: The date that this organization was dissolved.

inputs.name: foundingLocation
inputs.help: The place where this organization was founded.

Action.name: Action
Action.help: An action performed by a direct agent and indirect participants upon a direct object.

inputs.name: agent
inputs.help: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). E.g. John wrote a book.

inputs.name: object
inputs.help: The object upon which the action is carried out, whose state is kept intact or changed. Also known as the semantic roles patient, affected or undergoer (which change their state) or theme (which doesn't). E.g. John read a book.

inputs.name: participant
inputs.help: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. E.g. John wrote a book with Steve.

CreateAction.name: CreateAction
CreateAction.help: The act of deliberately creating/producing/generating/building a result out of the agent.

inputs.name: agent
inputs.help: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). E.g. John wrote a book.

inputs.name: object
inputs.help: The object upon which the action is carried out, whose state is kept intact or changed. Also known as the semantic roles patient, affected or undergoer (which change their state) or theme (which doesn't). E.g. John read a book.

inputs.name: participant
inputs.help: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. E.g. John wrote a book with Steve.
